author: EFE
title: ÃÃ±ez dice que Bolivia sigue ruta de â€œla tiranÃ­a consumada en Cuba, Nicaragua y VenezuelaÂ»
text:
La Paz.- La expresidenta interina de Bolivia Jeanine ÃÃ±ez (2019-2020) sostuvo este jueves que Bolivia sigue el camino de la â€œtiranÃ­a consumada en Cuba, Nicaragua y Venezuelaâ€, y considerÃ³ que el paÃ­s es gobernado por el Tribunal Constitucional Plurinacional (TCP) con fallos â€œdictadosâ€ por la AdministraciÃ³n de Luis Arce.
â€œBolivia estÃ¡ gobernada por un @
TCPBolivia cuyos fallos son dictados en el Ministerio de Justiciaâ€, escribiÃ³ ÃÃ±ez en la red social X.
Para la exmandataria, el Constitucional es un tribunal â€œcaducado y funcional al rÃ©gimen del MASâ€, el gubernamental Movimiento al Socialismo, â€œque ha prescindido de la Asamblea Legislativa siguiendo el camino de la tiranÃ­a consumada en Cuba,
Nicaragua y VenezuelaÂ».
ÃÃ±ez se pronunciÃ³ de esta forma en medio del conflicto por la prÃ³rroga de mandato decidida por el TCP para sus propios magistrados y para los jueces de los otros mÃ¡ximos tribunales del paÃ­s, a falta de las elecciones judiciales que debieron realizarse en 2023.
La preselecciÃ³n de candidatos estÃ¡ trabada desde el aÃ±o pasado en el Parlamento nacional, que sigue sin ponerse de acuerdo para convocar al proceso electoral, aunque ahora una comisiÃ³n bicameral y multipartidaria intenta elaborar una nueva ley para dar curso a los comicios judiciales.
La prÃ³rroga de los magistrados fue defendida por el Gobierno de Luis Arce que asegura que no es inconstitucional, mientras que los expresidentes Carlos Mesa (2003-2005) y Evo Morales (2006-2019) han criticado por separado la decisiÃ³n del Constitucional.
En la vÃ­spera, Mesa, lÃ­der de la opositora Comunidad Ciudadana (CC), sostuvo que la prÃ³rroga supone la â€œinstalaciÃ³n de una dictadura polÃ­tico-judicialâ€ en la que el Gobierno de Arce decide â€œlos destinosâ€ de la oposiciÃ³n y la ciudadanÃ­a.
TambiÃ©n el miÃ©rcoles el TCP emitiÃ³ una resoluciÃ³n para que el Parlamento reconozca la prÃ³rroga antes de iniciar el tratamiento de la ley que convoque a las elecciones judiciales.
Al respecto, Morales, que estÃ¡ distanciado del presidente Arce, considerÃ³ que los magistrados â€œautoprorrogadosâ€ estÃ¡n vulnerando la ConstituciÃ³n y sus acciones â€œcometen el delito de usurpaciÃ³n de funciones y son una amenaza para la democraciaÂ».
Sectores afines a Evo Morales bloquean carreteras desde hace once dÃ­as para exigir la renuncia de los magistrados y en rechazo a una sentencia del TCP que inhabilita al exmandatario como candidato presidencial al mencionar que la reelecciÃ³n indefinida â€œno es un derecho humanoâ€, un argumento que usÃ³ para postular a los fallidos comicios de 2019.

author: Paolo Moretti
title: Â«L'autista del bus dei bimbi era al cellulareÂ»
text:
Â«Lâ€™autista del bus dei bimbi era al cellulareÂ»
Lomazzo La Procura ha chiesto gli arresti domiciliari per lâ€™uomo alla guida del pullman del mortale di maggio. Nello schianto morÃ¬ una donna
Lomazzo
Quando gli agenti della Polizia stradale di Busto Arsizio gli hanno sequestrato il telefono cellulare, non aveva voluto fornire il pin per sbloccarlo. Ãˆ anche per questo motivo, per quello che Ã¨ stato letto come un tentativo di intralciare le indagini, la Procura di Como ha chiesto lâ€™arresto di Francesco Pagano, lâ€™autista del pullman carico di bambini che il 19 maggio scorso ha tamponato sulla Pedemontana a Lomazzo un camion della ditta Foti. Nello schianto Ã¨ morta unâ€™insegnante di 43 anni, Domenica detta Niki Russo, e molti bambini sono rimasti feriti: alcuni di loro con prognosi anche di 45 giorni.
Dopo poco meno di due mesi di indagini, gli investigatori hanno accusato lâ€™uomo di aver causato lâ€™incidente perchÃ©, nel momento del tamponamento, sarebbe stato impegnato con il telefono cellulare e non guardava la strada.
Lâ€™inchiesta
Pagano, difeso dagli avvocati Carola Balzarini e Davide Conforti (i quali, contattati ieri, hanno al momento preferito non rilasciare dichiarazioni), Ã¨ comparso davanti al giudice delle indagini preliminari Elisabetta De Benedetto per lâ€™interrogatorio preventivo, introdotto questâ€™anno dalla riforma Cartabia che impone - per tutti i casi in cui non Ã¨ contestato il pericolo di fuga - in caso di richiesta di arresto di informare lâ€™indagato e consentirgli di rispondere alle domande del gip prima di decidere se procedere oppure meno. La Procura - il fascicolo Ã¨ stato seguito direttamente dal procuratore capo, Massimo Astori, oltre al sostituto Simone Pizzotti - ha chiesto gli arresti domiciliari per lâ€™autista del pullman.
La vicenda la ricorderete. Alle 16.24 di lunedÃ¬ 19 maggio un bus della â€œAutoservizi Beltramini e Gianoli Srlâ€ di Golasecca in provincia di Varese tampona lungo la Pedemontana un camion per il trasporto terra, guidato da Matteo Vincenzi di Appiano Gentile. Nellâ€™impatto una maestra, seduta nella prima fila, muore sul colpo. Trenta bambini dellâ€™elementare di Cazzago Brabbia, che erano stati in gita al â€œMuseo del cavallo giocattoloâ€, vengono portati in ospedale. Alcuni di loro hanno riportato ferite serie. Poteva essere una strage.
Le verifiche sul cellulare
Gli agenti della Polizia stradale di Busto Arsizio, insieme a un perito tecnico, hanno lavorato in queste settimane per comprendere la causa dellâ€™incidente. Primo tassello: il video dello scontro, nel quale si nota come il pullman finisca contro il camion senza frenare, dando lâ€™idea di non averlo visto. Da qui le due ipotesi: malore (escluso dallo stesso autista) oppure distrazione. Dovuta a cosa? La prima causa a cui si Ã¨ pensato, ovviamente, Ã¨ lâ€™uso dello smartphone alla guida.
Da qui il doppio lavoro di agenti e perito. Gli agenti hanno recuperato tutte le telecamere dei portali di Pedemontana, che scattano le fotografie dei mezzi che passano. In una di queste foto si noterebbe lâ€™autista del pullman impegnato a guardare il telefono. Il perito ha ricostruito invece i tempi di utilizzo dello stesso telefonino, i quali coinciderebbero con le tempistiche dellâ€™incidente.
Da qui la richiesta di arresto, sulla quale il giudice deciderÃ  in questi giorni.
Â© RIPRODUZIONE RISERVATA

author: @kwtx
title: 4 Best Games Releasing in January 2024 | The Download
text: 4 Best Games Releasing in January 2024 | The Download From fists of iron to bricks for throwing. WACO, Texas (KWTX) - HAPPY NEW YEAR! A new year means different things to different people. Some of us will try to be better people, some will try to get their health order, but me? My resolution for this year is to play even more great games releasing. So, in order to facilitate this monumental task, itâ€™s time for me to guide you through this months game releases in your first Download of 2024. Prince of Persia: Starting the year off fresh is a franchise that has been languishing for some time. After 13 years Prince of Persia is so back though! An all new 2D side scrolling adventure sees a young warrior named Sargon, sent to rescue the Prince from dark and corrupted lands. Take on challenging platforming, gather all new powers and embrace the flashy dynamic fighting style to restore the lands to their previous beauty. I have been a huge fan of Prince of Persia since ancient days, so I know Iâ€™ll be diving into the sands when Prince of Persia The Lost Crown launches January 18th on PS4/PS5, Xbox One, Xbox Series S/X, Nintendo Switch and PC. The Last of Us Part II Remastered: This is an interesting one because, many of you may have been introduced to the gory, depressing and incredibly acted world of Naughty Dogâ€™s The Last of Us through last years HBO series starring everyone zaddy, Pedro Pascal. And as a result of a newfound love of that world, you may have even ventured out and picked up The last of Us part 1 on PS5. Well now you can revisit what is arguably one of the most depressing games Iâ€™ve ever played! ðŸ˜€ The Last of Us Part II remastered is a fully visually upgraded version of the 2020 PS4 exclusive now packed full of even more *CONTENT*. Including, new skins for Ellie and Abby, an all-new look at some lost levels, which will be represented in the second season of the HBO show and even an all-new roguelike experience pitting you against a never-ending string of combat encounters called No Return. Get ready to cry when The Last of Us Part II Remastered Releases exclusively on PlayStation 5 on January 19th Like a Dragon: One of my favorite game types is â€œgame about semi-serious stuff is full to bursting with goofy things to do instead of that semi-serious stuffâ€ Which is basically just the Like a Dragon series. The Yakuza have come to Hawaii, and so have our loveable oafs Ichiban. Its a goofy game packed with tons of hilarious mini-games, characters and side missions. Itâ€™s also gang warfare game about the Yakuza trying to take down another crime syndicate. Ride the dolphins to your hearts content when Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth releases Jan 26th on PS4, PS5, Xbox One, Xbox Series S/X and PC. Tekken 8: *New Challenger* Welcome back to the tournament of iron fists! Tekken has been a mainstay in my household since the original launched on PlayStation 1, so naturally Iâ€™m beyond hyped for a new entry. Iâ€™d go into details on the story but honestly if you donâ€™t know already itâ€™d be a 40-minute explainer to get you up to date. Just know this games story starts with a fight so epic, other games would use it as a final showdown. From cyborg-alien-demon samurai to my boy the tall haired Paul Pheonix. All your favorite characters are back, yes even the bear. Featuring all-new takes on the traditional Tekken formula this game will have you combo juggling fools in no time. Plus, this marks the first time the series has released using the impressive unreal engine so expect some gorgeous and out there visuals. -Get Ready for the Next Battle- When TEKKEN 8 launches January 26th on PS5, Xbox Series S/X and PC. Those are just a few of the excellent and wide-ranging games releasing in January. For the full list head over [KWTX.com](http://kwtx.com/) and hit the Hardwired Gaming News tab. Youâ€™re also going to want to go subscribe to the Hardwired YouTube channel because this is just the beginning of what is sure to be a jam-packed year in gaming. And hey if you have an idea or Gaming news story you can send them my way at [Hardwired@KWTX.com](mailto:Hardwired@KWTX.com). Until next time, Iâ€™m Andrew Hamilton for Hardwired. Copyright 2024 KWTX. All rights reserved.

author: Avneesh Vincent
title: Northland weather conditions ideal for planning outdoor activites
text:
A â€œsettled weatherâ€ forecast spells good news for Northlanders who wish to go fishing, travelling and swimming this week.
MetService meteorologist Mmathapelo Makgabutlane said the temperatures throughout the week would average about 22C with a mix of cloud cover, sunshine and mild afternoon showers.
Towards the weekend, an approaching â€œfrontal systemâ€ would bring in bouts of rain on Saturday.
â€œThe good news is that the system will improve by Sunday, which is expected to be sunnier and more pleasant.
Advertisement Advertise with NZME. â€œUpcoming weeks will also have a settled and comfortable weather averaging about 25C, which presents a good opportunity to enjoy outdoor activities these holidays,â€ Makgabutlane said.
For those going freshwater fishing, Northland Fish & Game regional manager Craig Deal felt the good weather forecast provided the perfect opportunity for licensed anglers to go trout fishing this season.
â€œItâ€™s an open season, so the regulations are quite relaxed. But having said that, people should catch no more than three trout per day, and they should measure no more than 30cm in size,â€ Deal said.
For people aiming to go saltwater fishing, fish such as marlin, tuna and mahi mahi were the common ones found during this â€œgaming seasonâ€, according to founder of Snap Fishing Ventures Nik Key.
Advertisement Advertise with NZME. With over 40 years of experience in the sea, Key teaches and guides people who want to learn how to fish â€“ using lures only.
He highly advises beginners to either go through a safety course or read the rules of being on the sea before taking to the water.
â€œWe encounter several people on the water who have no idea what they are doing and either end up putting their life or others at risk.â€
Once prepared, he insists beginners check tide times, along with the moon and bite times â€“ which is usually during early morning or at dusk.
Using fresh baits and kabura lures were some of the tips he offered for those wanting to improve their fishing aproach and catch rates.

author: RedacciÃ³n GestiÃ³n
title: Funcionario que recorte sueldo recibirÃ­a hasta 8 aÃ±os prisiÃ³n, advierte Poder Judicial
text: Los [funcionarios pÃºblicos](https://gestion.pe/peru/politica/congreso-blinda-a-maria-cordero-jon-tay-y-la-salva-de-la-inhabilitacion-mochasueldos-noticia/) que abusan de su cargo y obliguen a un trabajador a otorgarle a Ã©l o a un tercero, un bien o cualquier beneficio patrimonial indebido, estarÃ¡n cometiendo un [delito de concusiÃ³n](https://gestion.pe/peru/politica/comision-de-etica-aprueba-abrir-investigacion-contra-darwin-espinoza-y-kira-alcarraz-noticia/) y podrÃ­an ser condenados de dos a ocho aÃ±os de prisiÃ³n efectiva; asÃ­ lo informÃ³ el juez supremo provisional Ricardo Brousset Salas. â€œEste delito se produce cuando el [empleado pÃºblico](https://gestion.pe/peru/politica/comision-de-etica-aprueba-abrir-investigacion-contra-darwin-espinoza-y-kira-alcarraz-noticia/), abusando de su cargo, obliga, induce o hace prometer a una persona otorgar a Ã©l o a una tercera persona un bien o cualquier beneficio patrimonial, entiÃ©ndase, indebidoâ€, expresÃ³. AdemÃ¡s, resaltÃ³ que esta falta es un delito contra la administraciÃ³n pÃºblica, por lo que quienes pueden cometerlo son solo los [funcionarios o servidores pÃºblicos](https://gestion.pe/peru/politica/congreso-da-marcha-atras-y-aprueba-levantar-la-inmunidad-a-maria-cordero-jon-tay-mochasueldos-noticia/). LEA TAMBIÃ‰N: [Congreso da marcha atrÃ¡s y aprueba levantar la inmunidad a MarÃ­a Cordero Jon Tay] Aparte de recibir una pena de cÃ¡rcel, el magistrado mencionÃ³ que los responsables deberÃ¡n pagar una pena de 180 a 365 dÃ­as de multa (un porcentaje de la remuneraciÃ³n diaria del imputado). â€œComo es un [delito contra la administraciÃ³n pÃºblica](https://gestion.pe/peru/politica/congreso-da-marcha-atras-y-aprueba-levantar-la-inmunidad-a-maria-cordero-jon-tay-mochasueldos-noticia/), tambiÃ©n tiene la pena de inhabilitaciÃ³n en el cargo, este delito no tiene agravantesâ€, refiriÃ³. La aplicaciÃ³n de la pena por este delito tiene diferentes factores: â€œLas penas mÃ­nimas son para concusiones que deben entenderse como menos graves. Se conmina atendiendo si se dan circunstancias que agraven como montos altos, que afecten a una pluralidad de personas o que sea un alto funcionario pÃºblicoâ€. LEA TAMBIÃ‰N: [ComisiÃ³n de Ã‰tica aprueba abrir investigaciÃ³n contra Darwin Espinoza y Kira Alcarraz] El juez recordÃ³ que en el Parlamento hubo congresistas que abusaron de su cargo y contrataron empleados para su despacho, a los que les obligan a entregarles una [cantidad de sueldo](https://gestion.pe/peru/politica/congreso-blinda-a-maria-cordero-jon-tay-y-la-salva-de-la-inhabilitacion-mochasueldos-noticia/) para contratar a otro personal y tener dos trabajadores con un mismo sueldo: â€œEn ese caso serÃ­a concusiÃ³n en favor de tercero o para sÃ­ mismoâ€. Comienza a destacar en el mundo empresarial recibiendo las noticias mÃ¡s exclusivas del dÃ­a en tu bandeja [AquÃ­]. Si aÃºn no tienes una cuenta, [RegÃ­strate gratis]y sÃ© parte de nuestra comunidad.

author: The DirtKing
title: INTERIM TAG REMOVED: Meador named Head Basketball Coach at Chico State - HoopDirt
text:
As the Chico State menâ€™s basketball team prepared to embark on the 2024-25 campaign, they saw a transition of power at the head coaching position with three-year assistant coach Cevin Meador handed the reigns the week before their first regular season trip.
Despite the quick turnaround, Coach Meador has shown his readiness to take on the responsibility for the program following the teamâ€™s recent trip to the conference tournament championship game and an NCAA DII West Regional berth.
For that, Chico State Executive Athletics Director Eric Coleman has named Meador the 13 th head coach in the programâ€™s long-storied history.
â€œCevin stepped into a challenging situation just a week before the season tipped off and has led our team with poise, passion, and purpose. He is a young man who is wise beyond his years, and it has been a joy to work alongside him. We are excited about the future of our menâ€™s basketball program under his leadership,â€ Coleman said in a statement. For Meador, becoming a head coach is a dream come true.
â€œI am extremely grateful to have the opportunity to be at such a great place in Chico State. It is a phenomenal athletic department with a lot of great people and coaches to work with. Thanks to Coach Greg Clinkâ€™s mentorship in the last three years, I feel prepared for this opportunity. Iâ€™ve learned a great deal from him and Iâ€™m ready for the challenges ahead of me. This is an exciting time for the Chico State menâ€™s basketball and Iâ€™m glad to be part of it,â€ Meador said in a statement.
Aside from Meadorâ€™s knowledge of the game, he has continued to nurture relationships with his team and the community. He has earned the respect of his colleagues throughout the years, and the community members have rallied behind the program throughout his inaugural season.
The Meador era official began on the road in Seattle with a conference crossover against GNAC/PacWest opponents Seattle Pacific and Azusa Pacific, a trip that Meador had accompanied the team on as the assistant coach. He won his first collegiate basketball game as the interim head coach against APU but ultimately split the weekend with a three-point loss to the hosting Falcons.
Their third game of the season was a difficult loss to the Urban Knights in San Francisco. Still, despite the slow start to the season, this did not carry on for long as the team went on to win 13 straight gamesâ€”a Chico State menâ€™s basketball record of consecutive wins in a single season.
By the end of the season, the â€˜Cats boasted a 23-5 record and finished second in the CCAA Conference standings, with a favorable chance of earning a trip to the west regionals regardless of their finish in the conference tournament.

Meador is in his fourth year as a member of the Chico State menâ€™s basketball coaching staff. Since joining the team, Meador has compiled a 56-30 record along with an NCAA West Regional title, an All-American, a West Region and CCAA Players of the Year, a CCAA Freshman of the Year and 13 all-conference selections.
After reaching the conference tournament semfinals in the 2022-23 season, Meadorâ€™s third year on the coaching staff brought the Wildcats back into the spotlight. Chico State went 21-9 overall and took fourth place in the CCAA. Despite taking fourth, the Wildcats were one of four teams in the CCAA to have participate in the NCAA West Regional, reaching the title game for the second time in three years.
Meador came to Chico State as the Wildcats returned to action after sitting out the 2020-21 season due to COVID-19. Meador helped coached Chico State to a 22-5 record but also clinched the programâ€™s third NCAA West Regional title in seven years and sending the Wildcats to the NCAA Elite Eight. He also coached Malik Duffy to numerous awards, including third-team All-American, both the West Region and CCAA Players of the Year, and first-team all-conference.
Meadorâ€™s coaching experience expands to the Division I, Division II, and NAIA college levels, winning big at nearly every stop. Before joining head coach Greg Clinkâ€™s Chico State staff in July, 2021, he served a one-year stint as an assistant coach at Lewis and Clark State College in Lewiston, Idaho. Working under Head Coach Austin Johnson, Meador helped the Warriors post a 22-2 record in 2020â€“21, capture the Cascade Collegiate Conference championship, and finish as the national runner-up at the NAIA Championships.
From 2017 to 2020, Meador spent three seasons on the sidelines as the lead assistant coach at California Collegiate Athletic Association (CCAA) rival Cal State Monterey Bay. He was involved in all aspects of the Ottersâ€™ program, including recruiting, teaching and logistics. He played a major role in fundraising, technology, and the teamâ€™s extensive community service efforts.

Meador began his collegiate coaching career as the lead student manager at Division I Boise State. For three seasons, he prepared scouting reports, edited videos for coaches, assisted in day-to-day operations, created player edits for prospective recruits, trained student managers, and assisted in game day setup.
